medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe back pain after a large meal.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began acutely after a large meal consisting of pot roast. The back pain was severe, achy, and constant, worsening over the course of the day. It was unrelenting and did not radiate to the abdomen or flank. Some nausea occurred but the patient did not vomit. No comfortable position could be found to relieve the pain. The patient went to the emergency department at 6:30 AM after 24 hours of pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, obesity, status post gastric bypass, possible COPD.
